activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D Hamley

records.addlTxt:
9:45 AM Defendant Matthew D Hamley in court. Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito in court for Matthew D Hamley.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
9:47  Deputy Eric Sedani, Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn, and direct by state. 
9:51  Copy of photos - offered by state, received by court. 
9:52  Witness identifies DE. 
9:53  Cross by defense. 
9:55  Court finds probable cause and binds over.  Bond continues. 

9:59   Attorney Dippolito moves to modify bond to allow limited contact with victim solely for purposes of child exchange. 
10:00 State relates. Kimberly Nearisen, Barron County Social Worker, gives statement. State relates.
10:03 Court relates regarding differentiating between criminal case and family case. Court denies request to modify bond.
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

11:21 AM Defendant Matthew D Hamley in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Matthew D Hamley, for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Rockow relates and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
10:38 AM Defendant Matthew D Hamley in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant states he called the PD office and he qualifies. 
Court resets.  
Next hearing to be in person before Judge Boyle.
Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with A.C.
Must not go anywhere alcohol is either sold or served for consumption on the premises, except for work purposes. 
Must not possess or consume any alcohol, anyplace, anywhere, anytime.

1:13 PM Defendant Matthew D Hamley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Alex Kitto in court for Matthew D Hamley, for today.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
